children.subject: This does not include units transferred from high school right? ex. AP
There are drop in appts on Wednesday. Please see the appropriate advising thread.

I have recently found myself on the registration hold and really want to talk to a CS adviser about it. All the earliest open appointments are either late next week or the week after. Is there any way to talk to a CS adviser (not over email) before this?

history.content:
Undeclared at 75 units (including in progress)
Beginning October 1, 2017, L&S will be placing a registration hold on students who are undeclared and have 75 units (completed + in progress). To remove this hold, students will need to meet with their intended major advisor to get signed Conditions to Declare and Program Plan forms, which are to be submitted to the College of L&S.

This registration hold will be enacted each semester until the student has declared a major. Please plan accordingly. Here are a couple of ways cs-intended students can prepare for this:

  1. Complete the Conditions to Declare and Program Plan forms for the CS major now and get them signed by a major advisor - make an appointment through CalCentral or visit drop-in hours on Wednesdays in Soda. Once completed, these forms can be turned in to the front desk at L&S in 206 Evans. No appointment needed to turn these in to L&S.
  2. Because CS is uncertain based on the GPA requirement, L&S often asks students to show a conditions to declare/program plan from a back up major.
  3. Find a backup major and declare! This may not be ideal, however, declaring in a backup major will prevent your registration from being blocked. Then, you can work with a CS major advisor to change your major to CS when you're admitted.

Note: L&S will not accept the Condition to Declare if the conditions do not seem feasible, thus, the hold will remain until you find an alternate major. So, please ensure that you schedule some time to meet with a CS advisor to do some program planning, if you have not done so already. 

Note: The 75 units does not include anything taken before the date of high school graduation. For jr transfer students, community college units transferred (up to the 70 unit max) do count.
history.subject: L&S CS Updates: Unit Cap
